nodes.label: Automated Bone Marrow Cytology System
nodes.summary: An end-to-end deep learning system for automated analysis of bone marrow aspirate whole slide images, from region selection to cell classification, culminating in a patient-specific cytological summary.

nodes.label: Region of Interest (ROI) Detection
nodes.summary: The first step of the system, which automatically identifies and selects regions suitable for cytological analysis from a large whole slide image (WSI).

nodes.label: Algorithm
nodes.summary: A fine-tuned DenseNet model is employed for rapid and automatic selection of appropriate ROI tiles.

nodes.label: Performance Metrics
nodes.summary: The ROI detection model achieves high accuracy and precision in identifying suitable areas.

nodes.label: Cell Detection and Classification
nodes.summary: The core component that simultaneously identifies individual cells within the selected ROIs, localizes them with bounding boxes, and assigns them to specific cell classes.

nodes.label: Algorithm: YOLO (You Only Look Once)
nodes.summary: A YOLO model, specifically YOLOV4, is used for real-time object detection and classification in a single step, making it computationally efficient.

nodes.label: Mechanism
nodes.summary: Solves detection and classification simultaneously using a regression approach, outputting both object localization (bounding box) and class probability.

nodes.label: Optimization
nodes.summary: YOLOV4 is optimized for small object detection and uses complete intersection-over-union (CIoU) loss for faster convergence and better accuracy.

nodes.label: Performance Metrics
nodes.summary: The model demonstrates strong performance in accurately detecting and classifying 16 key cellular and non-cellular objects.

nodes.label: Histogram of Cell Types (HCT)
nodes.summary: A novel representation that summarizes the collective cytological information for a patient, acting as a unique 'cytological patient fingerprint'.

nodes.label: Definition
nodes.summary: A quantitative summary of the class probability distribution of all identified bone marrow cell types in a sample.

nodes.label: Purpose
nodes.summary: To provide a comprehensive and standardized summary of complex cytomorphological data, supporting more efficient, consistent, and automated diagnostic workflows in hematology.

nodes.label: Machine-Learning Algorithm for Bone Marrow Cell Differential Counting
nodes.summary: Development and validation of an AI-based algorithm using a Mask R-CNN model to automate the differential counting of nucleated cells in bone marrow aspiration smears.

nodes.label: Study Objective
nodes.summary: To develop and clinically validate an artificial intelligence (AI) algorithm capable of identifying and classifying nucleated cells in bone marrow (BM) smears to automate the differential counting process.

nodes.label: Methodology
nodes.summary: An AI model was trained using a large, expert-annotated dataset of BM cell images and subsequently validated on a separate multinational clinical dataset to evaluate its performance.

nodes.label: AI Model Architecture
nodes.summary: A Mask Region-based Convolutional Neural Network (Mask R-CNN) was employed. This model is capable of simultaneously detecting the location of individual cells and classifying their type.

nodes.label: Training Process
nodes.summary: The model was trained on a large dataset of BM smear images where individual cells were annotated by experts. Consensus meetings were held to ensure consistent classification criteria among experts from different institutes.

nodes.label: Staining Methods
nodes.summary: The bone marrow slides used for training and validation were stained with either Liu’s stain (85.1%) or Wright–Giemsa stain (14.9%).

nodes.label: Datasets Used
nodes.summary: The study utilized distinct datasets for the training and validation phases to ensure a robust evaluation of the model's real-world performance.

nodes.label: Training and Testing Dataset
nodes.summary: Consisted of 542 slides containing a total of 597,222 expert-annotated cells. A subset of this data, containing 26,170 cells, was used as the internal testing set.

nodes.label: Multinational Validation Dataset
nodes.summary: A real-world dataset comprising 200,639 cells, collected from three medical centers in Taiwan and one in the United States, was used for external validation.

nodes.label: Performance and Results
nodes.summary: The AI model achieved high accuracy in cell classification and showed a strong correlation with manual counting methods, demonstrating its potential for clinical application.

nodes.label: Internal Testing Accuracy
nodes.summary: The model achieved an accuracy of 0.94 on the internal testing dataset of 26,170 cells.

nodes.label: Validation Performance
nodes.summary: On the multinational real-world dataset, the model achieved an overall accuracy of 0.881 for classifying individual cells.

nodes.label: Cell-Specific Precision
nodes.summary: The model demonstrated high precision for classifying key cell types: Blasts (0.927), Bands and Polymorphonuclear Neutrophils (0.955), Plasma cells (0.930), and Lymphocytes (0.789).

nodes.label: Correlation with Manual Counting
nodes.summary: When assessing the differential counting percentage of each cell type, a strong correlation (ρ > 0.8) was observed between the AI and manual methods for most cell categories.

nodes.label: Challenges in Automated BM Analysis
nodes.summary: The paper outlines the difficulties associated with manual bone marrow analysis and the development of automated AI solutions.

nodes.label: Limitations of Manual Counting
nodes.summary: Manual differential counting is labor-intensive, time-consuming, subject to high interobserver variability, and prone to sampling bias due to the limited number of cells (typically 500) evaluated.

nodes.label: AI Development Challenges
nodes.summary: Key challenges include collecting sufficient high-quality BM samples across a wide range of diseases, the lack of routine digital imaging for BM smears, and the time-consuming, expert-dependent nature of cell annotation.
